title: Simple Present vs. Present Continuous Tense

questions.question: The shirt ................................ fine, but the trousers are small.
questions.description: The word fit is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: She ................................ at the screen.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about an ongoing situation.

questions.question: The whole family ................................ a leisurely walk in the park now.
She ............................. to be a perfectly sane person.
questions.description: The word appear is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: It .............................. like you are no longer interested in me.
questions.description: The word look is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: I ........................... the fabric to see if it is rough.
Both my children ............................... playing football.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about likes, dislikes, preferences etc.

questions.question: She ............................... in a new play.
questions.description: When appear refers to an action, it is normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: He .............................. upset.
questions.description: The word seem is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: What ......................... you ........................... at?
questions.description: When look refers to an action, it is commonly used in the continuous form.

questions.question: This color ......................... me.
questions.description: The word suit is not normally used in the continuous form.
